title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
content:
THRIVE WELLNESS - FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Q: How long does shipping take?
A: Standard shipping takes 5-7 business days within the US. Express shipping (2-3 business days) is available at checkout for $9.99.

Q: What is your return policy?
A: Since our products are tangible wellness items, we do not accept returns. However, if you receive a damaged or defective product, please contact us immediately at thrivewellness.il@veinternational.org for a replacement.

Q: Are your products BPA-free?
A: Yes! All Thrive products are made with BPA-free, food-grade materials that are safe for everyday use.

Q: How do I clean my water bottle?
A: Our bottles are dishwasher safe (top rack). For best results, we recommend hand washing with warm soapy water and letting it air dry.

Q: Do you ship internationally?
A: Yes! We ship to all 50 US states and internationally to select countries. International shipping takes 10-14 business days.

Q: What payment methods do you accept?
A: We accept Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover, and other major credit and debit cards. We also support bank transfers and digital payment methods. All transactions are processed through the VEI portal.

Q: Are the supplements vegan?
A: Our Surge IV electrolytes are vegan-friendly. Peak Protein contains whey protein, which is vegetarian but not vegan. Check individual product pages for detailed ingredient information.

Q: What is Thrive Wellness?
A: Thrive Wellness is a Virtual Enterprises International (VEI) educational project. We create premium wellness products including water bottles, supplements, and accessories as part of our business education curriculum.

Q: How can I contact you?
A: Email us at thrivewellness.il@veinternational.org. We typically respond within 24-48 business hours.

Q: Where are you located?
A: Our headquarters is at 2590 Ogden Ave, Aurora, IL 60504.

Q: What are your business hours?
A: Monday - Friday, 9AM - 5PM CST.

Q: Who is the CEO?
A: Alice Ho is our Chief Executive Officer.

Q: What's your most popular product?
A: Peak Protein Chocolate and The Iceberg water bottle are customer favorites!

Q: Do you offer discounts?
A: Yes! Our bundles offer significant savings - up to $500+ off with the Peloton x Thrive Bundle.

A product line of personalized  water bottles made out of lightweight recycled metal, with their key feature

We have observed and surveyed students in school hallways, libraries, and gyms, and noticed a common

social media, there has also been rising trends in going to the gym, eating healthy, and staying healthy: this

where to begin. Additionally, research conducted by the National Library of Medicine shows that 46% of

Welcome

Dear Thrive Team Member,

We are thrilled to welcome you to Thrive! You’ve joined a company built on the profound belief that wellness isn't a luxury, but a necessity for all. Our mission is to make wellness simple for everyone.

At Thrive our slogan is wellness that works. This represents our dedication to making our products effective and easy to use in everyday life. Our goal is to give our customers noticeable improvements in their health and energy.

This Employee Handbook outlines our collective values, covers the procedures that keep us running smoothly, and details the many benefits and programs designed to support you. We want to ensure you have the clarity and structure you need to excel professionally while feeling fully supported personally.

We encourage open dialogue, self-care, and collaborative energy that respects the unique perspective and contribution each of you brings. As you dedicate your energy to our mission, we are equally committed to dedicating ours to you. We're here to give you the tools and resources you need to maintain that critical balance, so you can keep thriving.

Thank you for choosing to share your talent and passion with us. We are your dedicated resource for navigating your career here and look forward to seeing all that we will achieve together as we empower the world to Fuel its flow.

Here’s to a journey of growth, balance, and success!

With warmth and support,

Your HR department

Manage inventory levels; coordinate purchasing of inventory w/ Accounting Dept.
Conduct weekly and monthly product sales analysis
Negotiate sales agreements with other VEI firms
Prepare and deliver sales pitch to non-VE partners for large sales agreements
Create sales contracts for non-VE partners
Conduct sales training for all employees prior to in-person and online trade shows
Update products listings in the Trade Show POS system
Other duties as assigned by chiefs and facilitator












Workplace Policies

Confidentiality and Data Production
We want to ensure that private information about employees, partners, and our company is well-protected. The following policy is important for our company’s reputation. 

Examples of confidential information are:
Employee Records
Data of customers and partners
Customer lists 
You must:
Only disclose information to other employees when it's necessary and authorized
You must not:
Use confidential information for your personal benefit or profit
Disclose confidential information to anyone outside of our company

Harassment
To build a productive workplace, we need everyone to treat others well and help them feel safe.
Harassment is a broad term and may include seemingly harmless actions, for example:
Sabotaging someone’s work on purpose
Gossip
Singling someone out perform tasks unrelated to their job against their will
If there is a conflict or you feel you are being harassed let your manager and/or Human Resources.

Discrimination
There will be no tolerance for discrimination against employees based on race, ethnicity, sex, religion.

Bathroom Policy
Fill out Securly and grab the pass to go to the restroom. Only one person should go at a time. 












Employee Code of Conduct
All employees here at Thrive must maintain a professional and well-mannered mindset. For example, profanity is prohibited, attire must be school appropriate, and everyone should be ready to openly communicate and contribute to the betterment of Thrive. Everyone should be willing to consider other perspectives and resolve conflicts efficiently.

Lateness
Everyone should be on time to class. After 3 occurrences of unexcused absences, disciplinary action will be taken. 

Dress Code
Most days casual wear will be fine, however during trade shows and other formal events business casual/professional attire will be required.

Working Hours
In class everyone is expected to be on task and completing work to further the success of this company. If extra work is required at home, you are expected to get that work done on your own time and be ready for class the next day.

Cell Phones
All phones should be in the phone pocket unless being used for our class (TikTok, Instagram, Remind, etc.)

Corporate Email and Social Media
Every employee is expected to check their email each day in case of any communication. If any further communication is needed, the Remind app and Group Me will be used. Instagram and TikTok will be used to promote our company.

Attendance
Everyone is expected to be in class each day on time unless you have notified your chief and Mr. Owles ahead of time. If absences start to pill up and get out of hand, further disciplinary action will be taken.












Payroll and Performance Management

Employee of the Month
Each month at the end of the month the chiefs will all get together and discuss who the employee of the month was for that month. That individual will get recognized in class and on the bulletin board as well as earning a bonus.

Paid Time Off (PTO)
Each employee will receive 3 days of paid time off per semester. HR will keep track of how many days you have used. If you don’t use all 3 days of PTO first semester, your remaining days will carry over to second semester. If you don’t contact your chief ahead of time that you will be absent, that day is considered an unexcused absence and will not be used as a day of PTO.

Bonuses
If your hard work is recognized by your chief or other employees there is a chance of getting a bonus on your paycheck. 

Employee Evaluations
Throughout the course of the year there are 4 evaluations completed before that month’s company meeting. Every employee completes a self evaluation and an evaluation form for their respective chief and CEO. Chiefs will then fill out an evaluation for their executives and CEO. 

















Employee Acknowledgement

I confirm that I have read this handbook and agree to abide by the policies, rules, and procedures. I understand that adherence to these standards is essential for maintaining a productive and professional environment.  If I need any clarification regarding any policy, I understand that I should feel free to ask human resources.
